product_name: KRISTIN ESS HAIRWorking Texture Loose Styling Powder
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeSustainable PackagingGive BackVolume boosting + texture enhancing, Kristin Ess Hair's Working Texture Loose Styling Powder for Buildable Volume + Texture creates instant grip in hair with a medium hold.
details: DetailsBenefitsThe ultimate braid aidGreat for thickening braids and creating grip in hairKeeps braids from unraveling and falling apartProvides flexible volume while adding instant fullness + textureFor all hair typesContains Zip-Up Technology: Proprietary strengthening complex designed to "zip-up" split ends while targeting weak areas of the hair, smoothing the appearance of damaged cuticles and helping protect hair from environmental stressors + color fadeCruelty FreeColor + Keratin SafeFormulated WithoutParabensPhthalatesSulfatesItem 2579338How To UseCreate braids, waves or buns. Apply a light layer of powder to the hair. Gently tap the powder in until it disappears. Gently pull or massage the hair to increase volume.IngredientsWater, Propylene Glycol, Silica Silylate, Hydrated Silica, Algin, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Carrageenan, Cetearamidoethyldiethonium Succinoyl Hydrolyzed Pea Protein, Chitosan, Citric Acid, Coco-Glucoside, Gelidiella Acerosa Extract, Gluconolactone, Hydrolyzed Keratin, Hypnea Musciformis Extract, Litchi Chinensis Pericarp Extract, Salvia Hispanica Seed Oil, Sargassum Filipendula Extract, Sodium Benzoate, Sorbitol, Xanthan Gum, Fragrance.
how_to_use: Create braids, waves or buns. Apply a light layer of powder to the hair. Gently tap the powder in until it disappears. Gently pull or massage the hair to increase volume.

reviews.headline: Big Hit for my teen son.
reviews.comments: My son uses this product and he really seems to like it. He uses it everyday and even takes it back and forth to school. This product keeps his hair looking the way he wants without the build up like other products. He is still able to run his hands through his hair.

reviews.headline: the dumbest amount of packaging
reviews.comments: there is very little product for how HUGE the packaging is. the pump could be half the size. just a waste of plastic really. a bit disappointed.

reviews.headline: Will be buying again!
reviews.comments: Not heavy on my very thin hair!

reviews.headline: Great for fine hair!
reviews.comments: Kristen Ess products have surprised me again and again. It's a very nice pump-spray&a little goes a LONG way. I have fine, wavy hair that's very flat at the root& this gives a little lift without having to tease. Does leave a sticky hairspray feel.

reviews.headline: Great for fine hair
reviews.comments: Best texture product I've found that lasts. Smells amazing.

reviews.headline: Love it!
reviews.comments: Love this productâ€¦and you only need a little. If you only use a small amount, it works great!

reviews.headline: Perfect for an Edgy Pixie Style
reviews.comments: I have a short pixie haircut with a lot of fine, curly hair, and I want to get height and volume out of it. Like, a lot of height and volume. It's been difficult to do, especially for any significant period of time. This product is perfect- it feels sticky and adds a lot of grit and hold without weighing down my hair. I also really like the way it's dispensed- it can sometimes be hard to get powder products evenly distributed all over my head, so the "spray" style is really handy for that. I feel like this was the missing piece in my hair routine that hairspray, pomade, and gel all failed to fill.

reviews.headline: Absolutely love it!
reviews.comments: Works great for a volumizing, and texture. One of the best I've used.

reviews.headline: Great product!
reviews.comments: My son uses this and he's very picky but he likes the loose styling texture powder.

reviews.headline: Nope.
reviews.comments: The pump is terrible and the product itself is so sticky/tacky.

reviews.headline: This Is It!
reviews.comments: I have finally found the secret to volume for my fine flat hair! I've tried more expensive brands that didn't do anything to add volume or texture, but this Kristen Ess styling powder does both with ease, and with a lovely light scent. The price point is affordabke and the amount if product for the price is amazing! I don't ever want to be without this product and plan to repurchase soon!

reviews.headline: Amazing Texture Powder
reviews.comments: I love big hair and this stuff works great! Lightweight and doesn't weigh your hair down. Every bit as good as higher end expensive options but at a much lower price. Smells great and easy to use pump!! Highly recommend.

reviews.headline: I'll buy again
reviews.comments: it really does give lift to my flat hair. I'll be buying more. just gotta take time to figure out how to use it

reviews.headline: Great product.. horrible smell
reviews.comments: This product is amazing for doing what it's marketed to do! Great for added texture, not siper heavy, doesnt make my hair greasy.. BUT, it smells so horrible to me!! I am contemplating returning just because I'm afraid it will make me smell ðŸ˜­

reviews.headline: BEST TEXTURE POWDER
reviews.comments: I work doing hairstyles and i've tried higher end powders but this works same if not even better for less price and more powder! like wow!!!

reviews.headline: My favorite styling product
reviews.comments: I hope this styling powder never gets discontinued! It's the only thing that doesn't weigh my hair down, it provides great texture, flexible hold, and seems to let my hair just kind of fall into place with little effort on my part. It also lasts forever. I've had the same bottle for a year and there's still some left.

reviews.headline: There's better options
reviews.comments: I will say that this product works, and for the price I would definitely purchase. However, I do think there are better options. The big sexy hair powder is a 10/10 for me, but i think its ~$20 (wait for a sale). This product does give volume but I don't find it to be long lasting. I have to kind of run my fingers through my roots and get it going again. I also feel like feel like I notice flakes in my hair when I use this but honestly not sure if it's from the powder because I do have dry skin but never notice it with the big sexy one. You definitely get a lot of product and I love that it's a pump so you can easily apply. I just think this product is almost too sticky and you'll end up feeling the need to wash your hair within a day or two after using, which is a downside for me because I typically use this after washing my hair to give it some texture back, so it's not flat.

reviews.headline: Great! Just don't follow the directionsâ€¦
reviews.comments: I tried this product because I was looking to replace a volumizing product that has become hard to find. It's great!!! However, I find the directions for use to be so odd. I would never, ever put this product all over my hair (unless I was trying to create dreadlocks). But, if you concentrate it at the roots, it will give you tons of volume and lift, while leaving the length of your hair shiny and bouncy. I have fine, thin hair, and this will be my new go-to. Just rememberâ€” a little goes a long way, and use only on the roots! The price is a great value, too!

reviews.headline: This is not for normal people
reviews.comments: This stuff is basically powdered glue. I have fine, thin hair and was looking for some texturizer to give my hair volume (like the Batiste XXL powder that I can't find anymore). Instead, this stuff made my hair sticky, to the point where I couldn't even run my fingers throughout. I have experimented with using less, thinking maybe I overdid it the first time? This stuff is not for normal, everyday, "just want to add a little volume" person. This would be perfect for maybe a professional to use in an updo that needs to remain perfectly in place for 72 hours? Or maybe a synchronized swimmer to use to keep her hair in place? I don't think this is a "bad" product, it just really is not at all what I was looking for.

reviews.headline: I will order this product again and again! I will be using i
reviews.comments: I was using another product that does the same thing for several years. This product is my new daily product from now on. It's much better than the old product. It gives my straight, fine hair so much body. I have already told a friend about it and she bought it this morning at Ulta.

media.headline: Good quality, easy to use, attractive hair pins
media.caption: Beautiful hair pins

media.headline: Good quality, easy to use, attractive hair pins
media.caption: First try and almost the perfect up do!

faceoff_positive.comments: The Kristin Ess Full size Gold French Pin set is super elegant and adorable! This pin set is very simple to use and place in your hair. I have very thick hair and when I'm working or in a hurry sometimes my hair can get in my way and I need a quick solution. This set certainly makes it very easy to do a quick updo with a cute elegant touch to your hair. I will say this does not work the best for those with very thin hair unless your hair has enough length to make a nice twist up bun to place it in. This is definitely a great way to wear your hair differently for a change. The gold coating seems to be durable and not easy to scratch. The pins are not too heavy but just right so they don't pull down your hair or have an annoying heaviness to your hair. I certainly recommend this set for anyone looking or an easy updo for change.
faceoff_positive.headline: Excellent for Thick Hair!

faceoff_negative.comments: I had never used a French pin for my hair, so I didn't know what to expect. I had a hard time using these, I think because my hair either is not thick enough or not long enough. I tried pulling up tutorials on YouTube, however I just couldn't get them to hold my hair. I do think they are really attractive and have a nice look for a classic hairstyle.
faceoff_negative.headline: Classic design
